article: The other day I was having lunch with some friends. I noticed a young man struggling to get his drink. As I got close to him I noticed 36 _ . He was blind. I saw that he had not 37 _ gotten his drink so I went over and 38 _ to help. Then I took him by the hand and led him to the 39 _ . I asked him if he needed anything else and he said he was fine, so I 40 _ . Two hours later, I was 41 _ for my car and the rain started pouring down, and then I saw the young blind man. He was trying to 42 _ the street and using his stick to make sure that nothing was in his way. He pressed the button 43 _ the light would turn red and allow for a walking 44 _ . He was hesitant about crossing the street and just 45 _ there.  I went up to him and said, "Hi!" He smiled and said, "Hey! You are the young lady who helped me at the 46 _ ." I smiled and said, "Yes." Then I took the 47 _ man's hand and led him across the street. I asked him how he normally 48 gets around . He said he does fine but he never crosses the street 49 _ in the rain because he can never 50 _ if a car is coming since he can't hear so well over the sound of the 51 _ . I asked him how he knew I was the 52 _ person from the restaurant. He said that he remembered my energy and he could 53 _ it just like before!  I smiled as we 54 _ introductions for the first time. We made it to the other side of the street and he told me he was 55 _ now and could make the rest of the way on his own. So, we said good-bye and went our separate ways.
